title: Normal probability for mean lake water level

content.description: Scientists working for a water district measure the water level in a lake each day. The daily water level in the lake varies due to weather conditions and other factors. The daily water level has a distribution that is approximately normal with mean water level of 84.07 feet. The probability that the daily water level in the lake is at least 100 feet is 0.064.
content.question: Which of the following is closest to the probability that on a randomly selected day the water level in the lake will be at least 90 feet?

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
